Sentencas: The degradation of ionic conductivity in 6ScSZ and 3YSZ SOFC electrolytes was analysed via X-ray diffraction (XRD), 4-point conductivity and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) and the results present a consistent story: in 6ScSZ subtle but reproducible changes to the phase assembly in the form of a shrinking cubic shoulder are obtained with ageing at 900 degrees C, which closely corresponds to the decrease in ionic conductivity.
Titulo: On the conductivity degradation and phase stability of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) zirconia electrolytes analysed via XRD

Sentencas: This appears to be the gradual transformation of the residual high-temperature c or t '' phase to t'.
Titulo: On the conductivity degradation and phase stability of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) zirconia electrolytes analysed via XRD

Sentencas: Both the shoulders and the conductivity return after healing at temperatures above the ageing temperature but below the sintering temperature, bringing the samples back to the as-sintered state.
Titulo: On the conductivity degradation and phase stability of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) zirconia electrolytes analysed via XRD

Sentencas: Evidence of a type of short-range ordering (SRO) acting in parallel with the phase changes was seen in the EIS.
Titulo: On the conductivity degradation and phase stability of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) zirconia electrolytes analysed via XRD

Sentencas: Distortions on the XRD peaks such as humps on the left shoulder were almost never seen and appear to be a polishing artefact unrelated to changes in the conductivity.
Titulo: On the conductivity degradation and phase stability of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) zirconia electrolytes analysed via XRD
